Album Cover

Getting weird with Aussie Psych Album Design. | August 11, 2017 | 08:30

The point of this class project was to lay bare everyone’s taste in music. Sure, the assignment brief called for an analysis and redesign of a favorite album cover, but we all know the real reason was an all out hipster-art-school-music-design-snobbery-fest. I knew I had to flex my music muscles, and I chose to redesign the cover for King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard’s Paper Mâché Dream Balloon.

<source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-1008by1008-249280.webp" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-1008by1008-249280.jpg" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-672by672-249280.webp" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-672by672-249280.jpg" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-621by621-249280.webp" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-621by621-249280.jpg" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-414by414-249280.webp" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-414by414-249280.jpg" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-483by483-249280.webp" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-483by483-249280.jpg" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-322by322-249280.webp"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/gizzard-322by322-249280.jpg"type="image/jpeg">

When I began the project in earnest, I found this snobbery ploy to be less compelling than the actual re-design process. The original cover above falls short of conveying the theme of the album, and I feel that a redesign can solve some of those problems.

<source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-1008by714-45522c.webp" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-1008by714-45522c.png" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-672by476-45522c.webp" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-672by476-45522c.png" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-621by440-45522c.webp" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-621by440-45522c.png" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-414by293-45522c.webp" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-414by293-45522c.png" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-483by342-45522c.webp" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-483by342-45522c.png" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-322by228-45522c.webp"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-2-322by228-45522c.png"type="image/png">

In the Gizzard’s discography, this album is unique in its departure from paranoid acid rock to “mellow, de-fuzzed psychedelia.” To me, the emphasis on the toned down acoustic guitar overlaying lyrics with subversive meaning defines the album.

<source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-1008by714-4738bd.webp" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-1008by714-4738bd.png" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-672by476-4738bd.webp" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-672by476-4738bd.png" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-621by440-4738bd.webp" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-621by440-4738bd.png" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-414by293-4738bd.webp" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-414by293-4738bd.png" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-483by342-4738bd.webp" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-483by342-4738bd.png" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-322by228-4738bd.webp"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-3-322by228-4738bd.png"type="image/png">

My redesign takes a normal scene of friends gathered around the campfire and completely distorts it. The band members become trippy visions. The print is warped and interacts with the type to convey a reverence for the bootleg psych albums of old.

<source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-1008by714-a65bb6.webp" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-1008by714-a65bb6.png" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-672by476-a65bb6.webp" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-672by476-a65bb6.png" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-621by440-a65bb6.webp" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-621by440-a65bb6.png" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-414by293-a65bb6.webp" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-414by293-a65bb6.png" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-483by342-a65bb6.webp" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-483by342-a65bb6.png" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-322by228-a65bb6.webp"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-4-322by228-a65bb6.png"type="image/png">

With such a fun name, I’ve never understood why these guys would not depict a Lizard Wizard or King Gizzard on their album. Fortunately, I was able to correct this missed opportunity.

<source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-1008by714-fb4f6b.webp" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-1008by714-fb4f6b.png" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-672by476-fb4f6b.webp" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-672by476-fb4f6b.png" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-621by440-fb4f6b.webp" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-621by440-fb4f6b.png" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-414by293-fb4f6b.webp" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-414by293-fb4f6b.png" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-483by342-fb4f6b.webp" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-483by342-fb4f6b.png" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/png"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-322by228-fb4f6b.webp"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/album-5-322by228-fb4f6b.png"type="image/png">

I think this is a successful piece, bolstered by a fantastic critique. For a nosy person like me, it was very fun to dive into other people’s music tastes. Music is such a personal form of entertainment, especially for college students, and combining that with a critique led to some fiery discussions. Just goes to show that an ulterior motive for a class project is not always what it seems to be!

Wanna share?
